xml:
RALTITREXED

List of individual interactants: Raltitrexed

326914003 Thymidylate synthase inhibitors Drug action

Raltitrexed is a thymidylate synthase inhibitor.
Indications and dose

Palliation of advanced colorectal cancer when fluorouracil and folinic acid cannot be used

By intravenous infusion

  • Adult

    (consult local protocol).

 Interactions

Appendix 1 (raltitrexed).
Side-effects

Frequency not known

Alopecia; bone-marrow suppression; extravasation; gastro-intestinal effects; hyperuricaemia; myelosuppression; nausea; oral mucositis; thromboembolism; tumour lysis syndrome; vomiting

Conception and contraception

Pregnancy must be excluded before treatment.

Contraceptive advice should be given to men and women before cytotoxic therapy begins; ensure effective contraception during and for at least 6 months after treatment in men or women.

Regimens that do not contain an alkylating drug or procarbazine may have less effect on fertility, but those with an alkylating drug or procarbazine carry the risk of causing permanent male sterility (there is no effect on potency). Pretreatment counselling and consideration of sperm storage may be appropriate. Women are less severely affected, though the span of reproductive life may be shortened by the onset of a premature menopause. No increase in fetal abnormalities or abortion rate has been recorded in patients who remain fertile after cytotoxic chemotherapy.
Pregnancy

Most cytotoxic drugs are teratogenic and should not be administered during pregnancy, especially during the first trimester.

Considerable caution is necessary if a pregnant woman presents with cancer requiring chemotherapy, and specialist advice should always be sought.
Breast feeding

Discontinue breast-feeding.
Hepatic impairment

Caution in mild to moderate impairment.

Avoid in severe impairment.
Renal impairment

Reduce dose and increase dosing interval if creatinine clearance less than 65 mL/minute (consult product literature).

Avoid if creatinine clearance less than 25 mL/minute.
National funding/access decisions

NICE technology appraisals (TAs)

NICE TA93

Irinotecan, oxaliplatin, and raltitrexed for advanced colorectal cancer (August 2005)

Raltitrexed is not recommended for the treatment of advanced colorectal cancer. Its use should be confined to clinical studies.

 www.nice.org.uk/TA93
Medicinal forms

There can be variation in the licensing of different medicines containing the same drug.

 Drugs Powder for solution for infusion Drug classifications Raltitrexed Drugs Powder for solution for infusion
